MARKETVIEW_20041211 .1845



WEB TEXT



2004-12-11T18 :45:00



Video Rentals : The Three Hypotheses



Byrne
0,0 per


2004-12-11T18 :45:00



Scrappy underdog Netflix had its day earlier in the year , when it became one of the hottest stocks around ( sporting an eye-popping P/E in the high 900 's on the way up , and , thanks to a poor earnings report , over 1,000 on the way down ) .
2,2 org|1,1 org|4,4 org|12,12 org


There 's plenty of argument about the future of DVD and video rental , and Netflix represents a pure-play on one of the three dominant hypotheses :
15,15 org


I .



That business is O-V-E-R -- Between pay-per-view , video-on-demand , pirated movies , high-bandwidth Internet broadcasts , and the increasing availability of other media , it takes some faith to see any future for movie rentals .
1,1 org


Those who do n't have the requisite faith will point to these factors as proof that the business is dying and the movie business in general will need a pretty significant overhaul before it can make profits .
0,0 per|1,1 per|17,17 org|23,23 org|33,33 org


Movie rentals are no longer a cheap alternative to other ways of viewing films ; they 're the stodgy , expensive way .



There are n't any pure-play buys on this theory , but someone who believes it might overweight their portfolio in cable companies -- if they purchased any media stocks at all .
11,11 per|12,12 per|24,24 per|17,17 per|21,21 org
12,12 per|21,21 org| org-aff

Of course , there have been companies whose performance would perfectly mimic the validity of this idea , but Psuedo.com failed without producing a single show , and Broadcast.com was swallowed for $ 6 billion by Yahoo !
6,6 org|7,7 org|19,19 org|28,28 org|36,36 org


, to Yahoo !
2,2 org


's great regret .



II .



Not so fast -- it 'll just go online !



-- Anyone who wants to counter that argument would probably start by taking us back to 1997 , when in terms of time used , text was the most popular kind of information online .
1,1 per|2,2 per|13,13 per


At the time , and for years after , people argued that the traditional bookstore would become obsolete .
14,14 fac|9,9 per


After all , how could we stand for a rapaciously arborcidal medium like ' books ' or ' newspapers ' when we could transmit the same data as bits and bytes and save on transportation , too ?
5,5 per|21,21 per


As it turns out , of course , Amazon.com , BarnseandNoble.com , and a host of others simply took the bookstore model , attached a 56K modem , and declared themselves The Future .
20,20 fac|10,10 org|8,8 org|14,14 org|30,30 org


Netflix is doing much the same thing : Taking the traditional business online to cut costs and boost customer service .
0,0 org|18,18 per


III .



Who d' you think you 're kidding ?
2,2 per|4,4 per|0,0 per


You ca n't kill movie rental stores -- So there 's a big difference between movies and books : For books , the retail store is practically the sole medium of distribution ; if you do n't sell through them , books wo n't get sold .
24,24 fac|39,39 fac|29,29 fac|0,0 per|34,34 per|6,6 org


For movies , the video rental store is just one way to get videos out there ( though at 45-55 % of studio revenues , it 's a much more important one than people think ) .
6,6 org|25,25 org|31,31 org|22,22 org


But given the high valuations ascribed to bricks-and-mortar-and-dead tree booksellers like Barnes and Noble , Borders , and to a much lesser extent Books-A-Million , surely there 's room for a Blockbuster , along with a Movie Gallery or two .
9,9 fac|11,13 org|15,15 org|23,23 org|31,31 org|36,37 org


The latter , at least , still has room to grow .
1,1 org


By focusing on smaller , rural communities ( preferably the sort that considers DSL ' newfangled ' ) they 're WalMarting WalMart -- competing with Walmart 's awful in-store video rentals by offering better selection and much lower prices .
18,18 org|21,21 org|25,25 org|6,6 gpe|28,28 fac


The movie business is changing dramatically as the potential for online distribution grows , but like every other business it leaves lots of room for traditional operators to operate at traditional ( read : high ) profits .
2,2 org|19,19 org


The aggressive bidding war for Hollywood Video , featuring two of their competitors , a buyout shop , and one of the savviest raiders around , is proof that some people still think these stores are worth something .
5,6 org|11,11 org|12,12 org|16,16 org|23,23 org|34,34 org|30,30 per


And I 'm one of them .
1,1 per|3,3 per|5,5 per


Full Disclosure : For once , I 'm actually writing about something I own : I have shares of Movie Gallery , I 've suggested it to friends , and I 'd be quite thrilled if the stock went up .
19,20 org|6,6 per|15,15 per|12,12 per|22,22 per|30,30 per|27,27 per
15,15 per|19,20 org| org-aff

I do n't do ' sell targets ' , but I 'd probably hold the stock if it ran up anything less than 50 % from this level .
0,0 per|10,10 per


If I sell , I 'll post a notification one trading day beforehand .
1,1 per|4,4 per


Because Lord knows you care .
3,3 per|1,1 per

NEWS STORY



20030510



Court suspends independent paper for publishing letters deemed religiously inflammatory



KHARTOUM , Sudan ( AP )
0,0 gpe|2,2 gpe|4,4 org
0,0 gpe|2,2 gpe| part-whole

A state security court suspended a newspaper critical of the government Saturday after convicting it of publishing religiously inflammatory material , the newspaper 's lawyer said .
6,6 org|14,14 org|22,22 org|3,3 org|1,1 gpe|10,10 gpe|24,24 per
3,3 org|1,1 gpe| part-whole|24,24 per|22,22 org| org-aff

The Khartoum Monitor may not appear for two months and must pay a fine of 1 million Sudanese pounds ( about US$ 400 ) , lawyer Ngor Olang Ngor told The Associated Press .
1,2 org|17,17 gpe|31,32 org|25,25 per|26,28 per


Failure to pay the fine would result in a two-month extension of the suspension .



The sentence was the latest in a series of state actions against the Monitor , the only English language daily in Sudan and a leading critic of conditions in the south of the country , where a civil war has been waged for 20 years .
25,25 org|13,13 org|19,19 org|30,30 loc|35,35 loc|33,33 gpe|9,9 gpe|21,21 gpe
30,30 loc|33,33 gpe| part-whole|19,19 org|21,21 gpe| gen-aff

Ngor said the paper would pay the fine but it would also appeal the verdict .
3,3 org|9,9 org|0,0 per


The court ruling stated that the verdict and sentence would be submitted to the National Press Council , a government - appointed body , for approval , Ngor said .
1,1 org|14,16 org|22,22 org|19,19 gpe|27,27 per


The secretary general of the National Press Council , Hashim el-Jazz , did not answer repeated calls to his cell phone on Saturday .
5,7 org|1,1 per|9,10 per|18,18 per
1,1 per|5,7 org| org-aff

The court convicted the paper of violating article 25 of the Press Law , which prohibits the publication of material that defames religion or incites religiously unacceptable activity .
4,4 org|1,1 org


The charges arose from letters-to-the - editor published last month that dealt with religion .
6,6 per


One letter claimed that alcohol was not prohibited by Islam .



Earlier this week , security police detained the Monitor 's managing editor , Nhial Bol , for 24 hours .
8,8 org|5,5 per|11,11 per|13,14 per
11,11 per|8,8 org| org-aff

On his release , he was charged with incitement of public discord for publishing the letters .
1,1 per|4,4 per


Sudan has an Islamic-orientated government and a substantial Christian minority .
9,9 per|0,0 gpe|4,4 gpe|8,8 per
9,9 per|0,0 gpe| gen-aff

I found the following report that was presented to Congress recently about the shoulder launched missle threat to airliners , which this might very well be a precursor to : Recent events have focused attention on the threat that terrorists with shoulder fired surface-to-air missiles ( SAMs ) , referred to as Man-Portable Air Defense Systems ( MANPADS ) , pose to commercial airliners .
9,9 org|15,15 wea|44,44 wea|52,55 wea|57,57 wea|46,46 wea|18,18 veh|63,63 veh|39,39 per|0,0 per
39,39 per|44,44 wea| art

Most believe that no single solution exists to effectively mitigate this threat .
0,0 per


Instead , a menu of options may be considered , including installing infrared ( IR ) countermeasures on aircraft ; modifying flight operations and air traffic control procedures ; improving airport and regional security ; and strengthening missile non-proliferation efforts .
37,37 wea|18,18 veh|30,30 fac


Equipping aircraft with missile countermeasure systems can protect the aircraft even when operating in areas where ground-based security measures are unavailable or infeasible to implement .
3,3 wea|1,1 veh|9,9 veh|15,15 loc|14,14 loc


However , this option has a relatively high cost , between $ 1 million and $ 3 million per aircraft , and the time needed for implementation does not allow for immediate response to the existing terrorist threat .
19,19 veh|36,36 per


Procedural improvements such as specific flight crew training , altering air traffic procedures to minimize exposure to the threat , and improved security near airports may be less costly than countermeasures and could more immediately help deter domestic terrorist attacks .
24,24 fac|38,38 per|6,6 per|37,37 gpe


However , these techniques by themselves can not completely mitigate the risk of domestic attacks and would not protect U.S .
19,19 gpe|13,13 gpe


airliners flying to and from foreign airports .
0,0 veh|6,6 fac


Legislation introduced in the 108th Congress ( H.R. 580 , S. 311 ) calls for the installation of missile defense systems in all turbojet aircraft used in scheduled air carrier service .
5,5 org|18,18 wea|24,24 veh


While this legislation is still under consideration , Homeland Security appropriations designated $ 60 million in FY2004 and $ 61 million in FY2005 to fund a program to develop and test prototype missile countermeasure systems for commercial aircraft based on existing military technology .
32,32 wea|8,9 org|41,41 org|37,37 veh


It is anticipated that at the conclusion of this program , in January 2006 , the Department of Homeland Security will be able to provide a detailed analysis of the suitability of such systems for use to protect commercial passenger aircraft .

It 's always difficult to get used to a central fact of the modern economy : The best new technology will keep getting better at an absolutely astounding rate .



Usually , the improvement curve flattens pretty fast -- the usual auto industry / computer industry comparison works just fine ( According to the standard urban legend , Bill Gates notes that " If we 'd been making cars instead of software , you 'd get 500 miles to the gallon , need an oil change every 250,000 miles , and be able to replace your car for $ 200 , " to which a mythical GM executive replies " Ah , but if Microsoft made cars , they 'd crash three times a day , too ! " )
76,76 org|15,15 org|11,11 veh|38,38 veh|86,86 veh|88,88 veh|28,29 per|34,34 org|84,84 org|43,43 per|65,65 per|66,66 veh|77,77 per|12,12 org
65,65 per|66,66 veh| art|77,77 per|76,76 org| org-aff|84,84 org|86,86 veh| art|34,34 org|38,38 veh| art|12,12 org|11,11 veh| art

.



Anyway , a few announcements during the last two days underscore the fact that the growth in memory and processing power for computers is far from over : Hewlett-Packard is developing a new replacement for the transistor , and a consortium of software companies is backing a new technology that would allow discs to hold up to a terabyte of information .
28,28 org|40,40 org|43,43 org


No idea where this will end up : It 's not altogether rare that these announcements result in a very expensive project to develop something that , for whatever reason , is n't worthwhile to consumers .
35,35 per


But it 's important to remember that the status quo is never more than a snapshot -- investing as though it 's permanent is a recipe for disaster .
